question:
If $U = \{a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h\}$, find the complements of the following sets:
(i) $A = \{a, b, c, d\}$
(ii) $B = \{e, f, g, h\}$
(iii) $C = \{a, c, e, g\}$
(iv) $D = \{b, d, f, h\}$

Taking the set of natural numbers as the universal set, write down the complements of the following sets:
(i) $\{x : x \text{ is an odd natural number}\}$
(ii) $\{x : x \text{ is a multiple of 3}\}$
(iii) $\{x : x \text{ is a prime number}\}$
(iv) $\{x : x \text{ is a natural number divisible by 2 and 5}\}$
(v) $\{x : x \text{ is a perfect square}\}$
(vi) $\{x : x + 5 = 8\}$
(vii) $\{x : 2x + 5 = 9\}$
solutionSteps: (i) Complement of odd is even: $\{x : x \text{ is an even natural number}\}$
(iii) $\{x : x \in N \text{ and } x \text{ is not a multiple of 3}\}$
(iv) $\{x : x \text{ is a positive composite number and } x = 1\}$
(v) Divisible by 2 and 5 means divisible by 10. Complement: $\{x : x \in N \text{ and } x \text{ is not divisible by 10}\}$
(vi) $\{x : x \in N \text{ and } x \text{ is not a perfect square}\}$

question: Let $U$ be the set of all triangles in a plane. If $A$ is the set of all isosceles triangles, what is $A'$?
solutionSteps: A = Set of triangles with at least two sides equal.
The complement $A'$ is the set of triangles with no two sides equal.
Therefore, $A'$ is the set of all scalene triangles.
finalAnswer: The set of all scalene triangles.

question:
Fill in the blanks to make each of the following a true statement:
(i) $A \cup A' = \dots$
(ii) $\phi' \cap A = \dots$
(iii) $A \cap A' = \dots$
(iv) $U' \cap A = \dots$
solutionSteps: (i) Union of a set and its complement is the Universal Set $U$.
(iii) Intersection of a set and its complement is empty $\phi$.
